kevin_m_mcguirk wrote:

With respect to the original questioner, you need to learn how Java 
CLASSPATH works. Please Google for the appropriate tutorial.

Take care.

> Noel,
> I had the same problem -  I tried giving it a classpath right to the
> source directory (C:\junit_home\junit3.8.1\junit\samples) but it
> didn't work.  I set the class path to the top of the source tree
> (C:\junit_home\junit3.8.1).  And that worked.
> 
> - Kevin
> 
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "jax502" <jax502@y...> wrote:
>  > I just downloaded the junit3.8.1.  I followed the instructions such
> as
>  > setting the classpath to C:\QA\junit3.8.1\junit.jar.  But when I
> tried
>  > to test the installation by using either the batch or the graphical
>  > TestRunner tool to run the tests that came with the release, I get
> this:
>  > Class not found "junit.samples.AllTests"
>  >
>  > I am positive that I don't have a junit.jar in my jdk ext.
> directory.
>  >  Please tell me what to do.  Thanks!
>  >
>  > Noel
